comments: I did not care for Dr. Learst one bit. I had him a few years ago. (Fall 2008) Useful material was sparse between his normal lectures that featured nonsense and goofing off. Dr. Learst is a shining example of a professor with his head up his rear-end. Everything is about him and the character he plays in class - not about the students.
Professor Learst was swell, his classes were epic and he taught me alot about how to write a paper correctly. We had some interesting conversations too.

The class is one of the easiest I\'ve ever taken, just sitting around for hours talking about nothing. He does have a really hard policy on assignments, though... everything must be turned in, and it must be on time, or you fail automatically. I certainly respect the need to do hard work, but I think an automatic F for 5 questions a day late is dumb
